summary: Email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the Southern District of New York and attorneys Christian Everdell and Mark S. Cohen regarding scheduling a meeting about the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The emails indicate the attorneys represent Ghislaine Maxwell and coordination for an introductory meeting.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP corresponding with SDNY prosecutors about scheduling a meeting regarding the Epstein investigation, representing Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Attorney cc'd on email correspondence with SDNY prosecutors regarding scheduling a meeting about the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referenced as the client being represented by attorneys Christian Everdell and Mark S. Cohen in the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The investigation by the Southern District of New York referenced in the email subject line is regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Colleagues at Cohen & Gresser LLP, both involved in representing Ghislaine Maxwell.
Christian Everdell is an attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell in the SDNY investigation.
Mark S. Cohen is an attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell in the SDNY investigation.

events.title: Scheduling of Introductory Meeting
events.description: Email coordination to schedule an introductory meeting between SDNY prosecutors and attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell regarding the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: Attorneys Christian Everdell and Mark S. Cohen of Cohen & Gresser LLP were representing Ghislaine Maxwell in the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein as of July 2019.
The SDNY prosecutors were actively seeking to meet with Maxwell's legal team for an introductory meeting regarding the investigation.
The email chain shows coordination for a meeting on July 16, 2019, or shortly after, between prosecutors and Maxwell's attorneys.
The correspondence indicates the investigation was ongoing and active in July 2019, shortly before Epstein's arrest and death.
